definition: to soar/to rise high into the air
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: Take time out of staff meetings to share the successes of your employees.
sentences.chinese: 騰空開些員工會議來分享他們的成功。

sentences.english: A HUGE cloud of dust rose and an overpass disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 一片巨大的灰塵騰空而起，一座高架橋瞬間消失了。

sentences.english: I cleared off the bookshelf and put these new books on it.
sentences.chinese: 我騰空了書架，把這些新書放在上面。

sentences.english: Be considerate; please vacate your seat once you have finished using.
sentences.chinese: 推己及人，於用畢後，請立即騰空座位。

sentences.english: Forget about "flying. " I could barely walk.
sentences.chinese: 甭說“騰空”，我連路也走不了了。

sentences.english: The rocket lifted off from the launching pad.
sentences.chinese: 那支火箭從發射臺騰空而起。

sentences.english: Each diagonal pair of legs is raised and returned to the ground alternately , with cadence and a prolonged suspension.
sentences.chinese: 斜對角肢輪流擡高和落地，有彈力且騰空時間較長。

sentences.english: Dao bead collapse against chung, jade, droplet like smoke, it was a very complete post-flight males.
sentences.chinese: 搗珠崩玉，飛沫反湧，如煙霧騰空，勢甚雄厲。

sentences.english: The basket has already been emptied.
Under crane's assistance, the bus soars, is moved puts to the road nearby.
sentences.chinese: 在吊車的協助下，大客車騰空而起，被移放到公路旁。

sentences.english: The time they emptied out has a extension tendency with the game continuing;
sentences.chinese: 比賽後半程單步騰空時間有延長趨勢。

sentences.english: Fairies give local residents rice, then go away, sheep into stone.
sentences.chinese: 仙人將稻穗送給當地居民，言畢騰空而去，羊化爲石。

sentences.english: Each diagonal pair of feet is raised and returned to the ground alternately, with cadence and a prolonged suspension.
sentences.chinese: 斜對角肢輪流擡高和落地，有節奏並且騰空時間較長。

sentences.english: The Dutch boast that falling crime rates explain its empty cells.
sentences.chinese: 荷蘭宣稱犯罪率下降騰空了他們的監獄。

sentences.english: The plane cleared the runway and headed north.
sentences.chinese: 飛機從跑道上騰空而起，向北飛去。

sentences.english: The victorious Ninurta empties the Great Pyramid of its equipment.
sentences.chinese: 勝利者尼奴塔騰空了大金字塔的裝備。

definition: also written 機槍|机枪/machine gun
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
